subject: Coronavirus pandemic
title: Covid: Swansea's Cinema & Co appeals against court fine
article: The owner of a Swansea cinema at the centre of a Covid pass row has launched an appeal against her £15,000 fine. Last month, Anna Redfern, of Cinema & Co was given a 28-day prison sentence, suspended for nine months, after admitting contempt of court. She was also ordered to pay court costs of £8,940 and a £190 surcharge. It came after Redfern, of Uplands, reopened on multiple occasions despite being ordered to close by a district judge on 30 November. She was given 56 days to pay. A date for the appeal to be heard at Swansea Crown Court has yet to be set.
